text: Restaurant week in Madison lets you try places that maybe you usually wouldn't.  Tempest Oyster Bar is in the old Magus spot.  Three of us went on a weekday and the place was PACKED; we had reservations and were seated right away.  The service was attentive, but we were seated in the bar area and I thought it was loud.  The abbreviated menu was fine for us and we all ordered different appetizers, entrees and desserts so we had a bit of a tasting experience.  The <crab cakes> were OK, but my <smoked fish appetizer> was very good.  One had a <pasta and seafood medley> (the <pasta> was over done) but the <salmon> and <blue marlin> entrees were very good.  Hard to know if the desserts were made on premises since they were all just OK.  <Wine> list was good, overall experience good.  They can do a better job of fixing up the entry/vestibule; it was just STRANGE.
